page.title: 05MOVING AROUND DIPTFORD
page.content: The car is now the chief way of getting around. A high percentage of the population own cars and are therefore very mobile. For those people who have no transport they can be helped by the school{bus}service.If they pay amall fee they are allowed travel into the local town,Totnes.There us to be an old { {railway}line which ran from South Brent to Kingsbridge by the river Avon. It was builtin 1862 butunfortunately affluence and progress caused the closure of the line in 1963. The Diptford {Car }Scheme enbles anyone to travel by private car for the small sum of 1Op per mile to any destination. The scheme started in 1979 after a survey organised in 1979 by the Womens Institute.
